required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Biobehavioral Intervention in Gynecologic Oncology Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Psychological Changes in Cancer Patients Receiving a Biobehavioral Intervention: A Program Evaluation

brief_summary.textblock:
Baseline self-report outcome measures will be completed and additional assessments will occur mid-treatment , post-treatment , 3 months following completion of all sessions, and 6 months following completion of all sessions. Patients and therapists will complete the evaluation measures in private (at home, in an office).
At the University of Kentucky Markey Cancer Center, BBI treatment is offered in group and individual formats. The course of individual treatment varies and group treatment consists of 10 1.5-hour weekly sessions in the "intensive" phase, followed by 2 1.5-hour bi-weekly maintenance sessions. Individual treatment is one-on-one. In group treatment, there are typically 6-12 patients per group and 1 or 2 therapists. The intervention helps patients to learn adaptive coping strategies and how to apply them to daily stressors. Additional content discusses use of seeking information, enhancing social support, enhancing body esteem and intimacy, and maintaining positive changes.

primary_outcome.measure: Emotional distress as measured by Profile of Mood States score
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 months following completion of treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Cancer specific traumatic stress as measured the by Impact of Events Scale score
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 months following completion of treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Social support as measured by the Perceived Social Support from Family score
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 months following completion of treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Physical activity as measured by the Godin-Shepard Leisure-Time Physical Activity Questionnaire score
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 months following completion of treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Dietary habits as measured by the Food Habits Questionnaire
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 months following completion of treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Sexual functioning as measured by the Sexual Experience Scale score
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 months following completion of treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Pain as measured by the Brief Pain Questionnaire score
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 months following completion of treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Fatigue as measured by the Fatigue Severity Index score
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 months following completion of treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Sleep as measured by the Pittsburg Sleep Quality Index
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 months following completion of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient-reported evaluation of the BBI as measured by the Evaluation of Topics score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 months following completion of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Therapist-reported fidelity/Usage of BBI as measured through logs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 months following completion of treatment

intervention.description: Psychological intervention designed to reduce stress and enhance quality of life

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Females
- Stage I-IV gynecologic cancer (including ovarian, uterine, cervical, vulvar, or vaginal cancer)
- Undergoing active treatment or in remission and undergoing active surveillance; age ≥21 and ≤80
- Able to speak/read English.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Concurrent diagnosis of organic brain syndrome, dementia, mental retardation
- Non-English speaking, or significant sensory deficit
- Major mental illness (e.g., schizophrenia, psychotic disorder).

facility.name: Markey Cancer Center, University of Kentucky
